meanings.definition: To soil or stain with a spot or mark.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally beflecked her white shirt with spaghetti sauce.
meanings.sent2: The muddy dog beflecked the clean floor with paw prints.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous toddler beflecked the walls with colorful crayon marks.
meanings.sent4: The rain beflecked the window with tiny droplets, distorting the view outside.
meanings.sent5: The ink beflecked the paper, creating a unique pattern.

meanings.sent1: The children beflecked their clothes with mud while playing outside.
meanings.sent2: The dust storm beflecked everything in the house, leaving a layer of dirt.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppies beflecked the room with torn paper and scattered toys.
meanings.sent4: The artist intentionally beflecked the canvas with splashes of paint for a modern look.
meanings.sent5: The spilled coffee beflecked the tablecloth, creating a brown stain.

meanings.sent1: The scratch beflecked the shiny surface of the car.
meanings.sent2: The graffiti beflecked the clean walls of the building.
meanings.sent3: The typo beflecked the otherwise perfect essay.
meanings.sent4: The gossip beflecked her reputation, causing doubts among her friends.
meanings.sent5: The storm beflecked the landscape, leaving a trail of destruction.
